{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-260-08-A |Item_parent=Hematuria |Item_parent_short=Hematuria |Rank=A |Title=Photographs of a urine dipstick |Description=None |Rubric=Multimedia content |Contributors=Charles Dariane, Bruno Moulin |Order=8}}
[[File:Fig 4 BU temoin avec boitier.jpg|gauche|vignette|573x573px|'''Figure 4'''. Control urine dipstick.]]
[[File:Fig 5 BU hematuria.jpg|alt=- Figure 5. Urine dipstick demonstrating haematuria (3 crosses +++).|vignette|574x574px|'''Figure 5.'''' Urine dipstick demonstrating haematuria (3 crosses +++).|left]]

question.question: What does the presence of 3 crosses (+++), as shown in Figure 5, indicate on a urine dipstick?
question.option_a: The presence of blood in the urine
question.option_b: The presence of protein in the urine
question.option_c: The presence of glucose in the urine
question.option_d: The presence of a urinary tract infection
